sentences.en: All her images of a tiny waif locked in the attic seemed suddenly foolish and fantastic.
sentences.cn: 她所有有关被关在阁楼的那个小流浪儿的照片似乎突然变得愚蠢荒诞.

sentences.en: At first, it was difficult for Eva to find work. Those super - thin waif mannequins were in.
sentences.cn: 起初, 爱娃很难找到工作. 那些超级瘦的无主人体模型在那里.

sentences.en: Believe it not, the waif look was the hottest look of the 1990's.
sentences.cn: 不管你信不信, 细挑个儿可是20世纪90年代最酷的.

sentences.en: Maybe I should play this needy, despondent waif card more often.
sentences.cn: 也许我应该用用这个迷惑, 多需求的招牌.

sentences.en: The dirty-faced waif was only five or six years old.
sentences.cn: 这个流浪儿脸上脏兮兮的，只有五六岁大。

sentences.en: They looked thin, waif - like and half starved.
sentences.cn: 他们瘦骨伶仃,像流浪儿似的饿得半死.

sentences.en: They looked thin, waif - like and starved.
sentences.cn: 他们瘦骨伶仃,像流浪儿似的饿得半死.

phrases.tran_cn: n. 零碎东西；无家可归的人；流浪的动物

trans.tran_cn: 无家可归的人，流浪儿，无主的东西或动物，（海上）漂流物
trans.tran_en: If you refer to a child or young woman as a waif, you mean that they are very thin and look as if they have nowhere to live
